result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D. Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert D. Beck is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert D. Beck was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Robert D. Beck was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on August 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.

9:03 a.m. Defendant Robert D. Beck in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees states have a resolution - requests recess to complete Plea Questionaire. Recess 9:04 a.m. On record 9:18 a.m. Plea Questionaire filed. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to Counts 1 and 3.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
Count 1
CC/DNA Surcharge to be collected by DOC as a courtesy
Jail - 30 days with Huber for all purposes
Jail credit - 30 days 

Count 3
WHS/POP 1 year
CC - to be taken from bond posted with DOC to collect balance
DNA Sample 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Restitution - $126.50 (includes 10%) to be taken from bond posted
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Adj. 9:33 a.m.

1:58 p.m. Defendant Robert D. Beck in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Robert D. Beck in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees states no resolution - Bail continued. Adj. 2:01 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

2:33 p.m. Defendant Robert D. Beck in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant re counsel.  Defendant states John Voorhees has been appointed - Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
2:40 p.m.  Defendant Robert D. Beck in court, via video, in custody, with Attorney John Voorhees, via video in the jail.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Voorhees/Michlig statement to bail. Court takes motion to modify bond under advisement. Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 p.m. 
Bail continued
No intoxicants, no taverns, no controlled substances of any kind.

1:27 p.m. Kirk Reese, Court Commissioner for Judge Bloom. Defendant Robert D. Beck in court, via video, in custody.  District Attorney was to appear by telephone; however, technical difficulties occurred.  Heidi Ihn in court for DA's office. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - District Attorney's office by Heidi Ihn/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $500 cash bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 1:32 p.m.
